item.title: Fly tipped items, 9th August
item.description:
Can Peabody please have someone regularly check these corners of the park as people who fly to dump their items here and it's getting quite depressing to look at.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Avocet Mews, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping again, 9th August
item.description:
Lambeth Council is ALLOWING this to happen multiple times a week. They have not put up any signs to deter tippers. They have not put up cameras. This rubbish appears overnight and more is added to it. This really is disgusting. The only thing Lambeth have done is written to people who live in this road to tell them to stop doing it. When they are the people who actually care and report it. LAMBETH THIS MUST STOP

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lakeview Road, West Norwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping - brown leather sofa and some MDF shelving, 9th August
item.description:
Fly tipping - brown leather sofa and some MDF shelving - seen today (09-Aug). NOT fixed as reported elsewhere on this site. Sofa has been there at least 4-6 weeks. Location: corner of Tylney Ave garages and Farquhar Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tylney Avenue, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on signs in Alberta Street + general neglect, 9th August
item.description:
There are several issues on Alberta Street: Grafitti sprayed on street signs and the BT/communictions on the corner of Ambergate Street Weeds not being removed from pavements and gutters. Streets not being swept of leaves and litter. Generally litter everywhere, in flower beds, at the side of the road etc. Please can it be cleaned up.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alberta Street, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Domestic waste ⚠️fecal matter - cul-de-sac of Ravenscourt Road, 9th August
item.description:
Domestic waste has been fly-tipped in the cul-de-sac of Ravenscourt Road. This includes pet waste and food waste which has attracted wildlife. Bags have been ripped and the waste has been spread about. There are lots of flies about. Please could this be removed?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Arbrook Close, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 9th August
item.description:
This vehicle has been parked on front of the shop over 12 weeks without it moving at all. It does affect the every day operation of the business including deliveries and customer parking, especially some of our customers being from the older generation and/or disabled.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Salisbury Road, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet
